docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This guide explains how to install and run Ollama using Docker. Ollama is an open-source platform that allows you to run large language models locally, making it ideal for developers who need offline AI capabilities.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before proceeding with the installation, ensure you have:

  • Docker installed on your system
  • At least 8GB RAM (recommended)
  • Sufficient storage space (varies by model)
  • Docker Compose (optional, but recommended)

docs.title: 1. Pull the Official Image
docs.text: docker pull ollama/ollama

docs.title: 2. Run Ollama Container
docs.text:
docker run -d \
  --name ollama \
  -p 11434:11434 \
  -v ollama:/root/.ollama \
  ollama/ollama

docs.title: Understanding the Docker Run Command
docs.text:
• -d: Runs the container in detached mode
  • --name ollama: Names the container "ollama"
  • -p 11434:11434: Maps the container's port to host port
  • -v ollama:/root/.ollama: Creates a volume for persistent storage

docs.title: 1. Create Docker Compose File
docs.text:
Create a docker-compose.yml file:

version: '3.8'

services:
  ollama:
    container_name: ollama
    image: ollama/ollama:latest
    ports:
      - "11434:11434"
    volumes:
      - ollama:/root/.ollama
    restart: unless-stopped

volumes:
  ollama:

docs.title: 2. Start Ollama with Docker Compose
docs.text: docker compose up -d

docs.title: 1. Check Container Status
docs.text: docker ps

docs.title: 2. Test Ollama API
docs.text: curl http://localhost:11434/api/tags

docs.title: 1. Pull a Model
docs.text: docker exec -it ollama ollama pull llama2

docs.title: 2. Run a Basic Query
docs.text: docker exec -it ollama ollama run llama2 "Hello, how are you?"

docs.title: Stopping the Container
docs.text: docker stop ollama

docs.title: Starting the Container
docs.text: docker start ollama

docs.title: Viewing Logs
docs.text: docker logs ollama

docs.title: Common Issues and Solutions
docs.text:
1. Port Conflict
  2. Error: "port 11434 already in use"

  3. Solution: Change the port mapping or stop the conflicting service

  4. Insufficient Memory

  5. Error: Container exits immediately

  6. Solution: Increase Docker memory allocation in Docker Desktop settings

  7. Permission Issues

  8. Error: "permission denied" for volume
  9. Solution: Check Docker volume permissions and ownership

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Always use version tags for production deployments
  2. Implement health checks for container monitoring
  3. Use Docker volumes for persistent storage
  4. Regular backup of the ollama volume
  5. Monitor resource usage

docs.title: Security Considerations
docs.text:
1. Avoid running as root inside the container
  2. Restrict network access if running in production
  3. Regularly update the Ollama image
  4. Use Docker secrets for sensitive configurations

docs.text:

  • Ollama GitHub Repository
  • Docker Documentation

docs.title: Open WebUI: Introduction and Installation Guide
What is Open WebUI?
docs.text: Open WebUI is an extensible, feature-rich, and user-friendly self-hosted AI platform designed to operate entirely offline. It provides a modern web interface for interacting with various Large Language Models (LLMs) and comes with built-in support for Ollama integration. [4]

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• User-friendly Interface: Clean and intuitive chat interface with conversation history
  • Model Management: Easy model installation and switching
  • Multi-Modal Support: Handle text, images, and code interactions
  • OpenAI API Integration: Support for OpenAI-compatible APIs alongside Ollama models
  • Offline Operation: Run completely offline for privacy and security
  • Cross-Platform: Works on Windows, macOS, and Linux [2]

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Docker installed on your system
  • Minimum 8GB RAM recommended
  • 10GB free disk space
  • Internet connection (for initial setup and model downloads) [1]

docs.title: Method 1: Docker Compose (Recommended)
docs.text:
1. Create a new directory and navigate to it: 

    mkdir open-webui && cd open-webui

  2. Create a docker-compose.yml file with the following content: 

    version: '3.8'
services:
  ollama:
    image: ollama/ollama:latest
    container_name: ollama
    volumes:
      - ./ollama:/root/.ollama
    ports:
      - "11434:11434"

  open-webui:
    image: ghcr.io/open-webui/open-webui:main
    container_name: open-webui
    volumes:
      - ./open-webui:/data
    ports:
      - "3000:8080"
    environment:
      - OLLAMA_API_BASE_URL=http://ollama:11434/api
    depends_on:
      - ollama

  3. Start the containers: 

    docker-compose up -d

  4. Access the interface at http://localhost:3000 [1]

docs.title: Method 2: All-in-One Docker Image
docs.text:
For a simpler setup, you can use the bundled image that includes both Open WebUI and Ollama:

docker run -d \
  --name open-webui \
  -v open-webui:/data \
  -p 3000:8080 \
  --restart always \
  ghcr.io/open-webui/open-webui-standalone:main

Access the interface at http://localhost:3000 [2]

docs.title: Post-Installation Steps
docs.text:
1. First Launch:
  2. Open your browser and navigate to http://localhost:3000
  3. Create your admin account on first launch

  4. Select and download your preferred LLM model [4]

  5. Model Installation:

  6. Click on the 'Models' tab in the interface
  7. Choose from available models

  8. Wait for the download to complete [2]

  9. API Configuration (Optional):

  10. Navigate to Settings
  11. Configure OpenAI-compatible API endpoints if needed
  12. Set up any additional parameters for model interaction [3]

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Common issues and solutions:

  1. Connection Issues:
  2. Verify Docker containers are running: docker ps
  3. Check logs: docker logs open-webui

  4. Ensure ports 3000 and 11434 are not in use [1]

  5. Model Download Failures:

  6. Check available disk space
  7. Verify internet connection
  8. Review Ollama logs: docker logs ollama [2]

docs.title: Security Considerations
docs.text:
• The default setup exposes the UI on localhost only
  • For remote access, configure proper authentication
  • Consider setting up HTTPS if exposing to the internet
  • Regularly update both Open WebUI and Ollama containers [1], [4]

docs.text:

  • GitHub Repository
  • Feature Requests and Bug Reports

docs.title: FastAPI
docs.text: FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.7+ based on standard Python type hints. It is designed to be easy to use and highly efficient, making it a popular choice for developers looking to create RESTful APIs.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
FastAPI offers several powerful features:

  • Fast Development: Write less code and quickly build APIs.
  • High Performance: Built on top of Starlette and Pydantic, it delivers high performance.
  • Type Safety: Leverages Python type hints for automatic validation and documentation.
  • Interactive Documentation: Automatically generates Swagger UI and ReDoc documentation.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
To start using FastAPI, you need to install it. Use the following command:

pip install fastapi[all]

docs.title: Example Code
docs.text:
Below is a simple example of a FastAPI application:

from fastapi import FastAPI

app = FastAPI()

@app.get("/")
def read_root():
    return {"message": "Welcome to FastAPI"}

@app.get("/items/{item_id}")
def read_item(item_id: int, q: str = None):
    return {"item_id": item_id, "q": q}

Save this code in a file (e.g., main.py) and run it using Uvicorn:

uvicorn main:app --reload

Once the server is running, you can access the API documentation at:

  • Swagger UI: http://127.0.0.1:8000/docs
  • ReDoc: http://127.0.0.1:8000/redoc

docs.title: Path Parameters
docs.text:
FastAPI allows you to define path parameters easily. For example:

@app.get("/users/{user_id}")
def get_user(user_id: int):
    return {"user_id": user_id}

docs.title: Query Parameters
docs.text:
You can also define optional query parameters:

@app.get("/search/")
def search_items(query: str = None):
    return {"query": query}

docs.title: Request Body
docs.text:
FastAPI uses Pydantic models for request validation:

from pydantic import BaseModel

class Item(BaseModel):
    name: str
    description: str = None
    price: float
    tax: float = None

@app.post("/items/")
def create_item(item: Item):
    return {"item": item}

docs.title: Dependency Injection
docs.text:
FastAPI supports dependency injection for reusable logic:

from fastapi import Depends

def common_dependency():
    return {"key": "value"}

@app.get("/dependencies/")
def read_dependencies(dep=Depends(common_dependency)):
    return {"dependency": dep}

docs.title: Resources
docs.text:
Here are some useful resources to learn more about FastAPI:

  • FastAPI Documentation
  • GitHub Repository
  • Uvicorn Documentation

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text: FastAPI is an excellent choice for building APIs quickly and efficiently. Its modern design, type safety, and built-in documentation make it a favorite among Python developers. Start building your next API with FastAPI today!

docs.title: Python 概覽
docs.text: Python 是一種多功能且廣泛使用的程式語言，以其簡單、可讀性高以及豐富的函式庫支援而聞名。它常被用於網頁開發、資料分析、人工智慧、科學計算等多種應用領域。

docs.title: 為什麼學習 Python？
docs.text:
Python 擁有多項特性，使其成為開發者的熱門選擇：

  • 易於使用：Python 擁有簡單且清晰的語法，對於初學者與有經驗的開發者來說都非常友好。
  • 多功能性：Python 可用於多種應用，包括網頁開發、腳本編寫、資料分析、機器學習等。
  • 社群支援：Python 擁有龐大且活躍的社群，提供豐富的文件、教學資源及第三方函式庫。

docs.title: Python 的主要特性
docs.text:
• 直譯式語言：Python 不需要編譯，讓開發過程更加快速與靈活。
  • 跨平台：Python 可在所有主流平台上運行，包括 Windows、macOS 和 Linux。
  • 豐富的函式庫：Python 擁有豐富的函式庫與框架，例如 NumPy、Pandas、Django 和 Flask，可大幅簡化開發工作。

docs.title: Python 的常見應用
docs.text:
1. 網頁開發 使用像 Django 和 Flask 這樣的框架，可以構建出強大且可擴展的網頁應用程式。

  2. 資料分析與視覺化 使用 Pandas 和 Matplotlib 等函式庫，可以輕鬆進行資料分析與視覺化。

  3. 機器學習與人工智慧 Python 是人工智慧與機器學習的首選語言，擁有強大的函式庫，例如 TensorFlow 和 PyTorch。

  4. 自動化與腳本編寫 Python 的簡潔性使其非常適合編寫腳本來自動化重複性任務。

docs.title: 如何開始學習 Python？
docs.text:
以下是開始使用 Python 的步驟：

  1. 安裝 Python 從官方網站下載並安裝 Python：python.org。

  2. 學習基礎 使用線上教學資源探索 Python 的語法與核心概念，例如 Python 初學者指南。

  3. 練習程式設計 使用像 LeetCode 和 HackerRank 這樣的平台，練習程式設計問題並提升技能。

  4. 探索函式庫與框架 開始嘗試使用像 NumPy、Pandas 和 Matplotlib 這樣的熱門函式庫來構建專案並獲得實際經驗。

docs.title: 其他資源
docs.text:
以下是一些有助於深入學習 Python 的資源：

  • 官方 Python 文件
  • Real Python 教學
  • Python 軟體包索引 (PyPI)

Python 的多功能性與易用性使其成為所有層級開發者的絕佳選擇。無論是構建網頁應用、分析資料，還是探索人工智慧，Python 都擁有工具與社群來支持你的學習旅程。

docs.title: Python Overview
docs.text: Python is a versatile and widely-used programming language known for its simplicity, readability, and extensive library support. It is commonly used in web development, data analysis, artificial intelligence, scientific computing, and more.

docs.title: Why Learn Python?
docs.text:
Python has several features that make it a popular choice for developers:

  • Ease of Use: Python has a simple and clean syntax, making it an excellent choice for beginners and experienced developers alike.
  • Versatility: Python can be used for a variety of applications, including web development, scripting, data analysis, machine learning, and more.
  • Community Support: Python has a large and active community, providing extensive documentation, tutorials, and third-party libraries.

docs.title: Key Features of Python
docs.text:
• Interpreted Language: Python does not require compilation, making the development process faster and more flexible.
  • Cross-Platform: Python runs on all major platforms, including Windows, macOS, and Linux.
  • Extensive Libraries: Python has a rich ecosystem of libraries and frameworks, such as NumPy, Pandas, Django, and Flask, that simplify development tasks.

docs.title: Popular Python Use Cases
docs.text:
1. Web Development Frameworks like Django and Flask enable developers to build robust and scalable web applications.

  2. Data Analysis and Visualization Libraries like Pandas and Matplotlib make it easy to analyze and visualize data.

  3. Machine Learning and AI Python is the go-to language for AI and machine learning, with powerful libraries like TensorFlow and PyTorch.

  4. Automation and Scripting Python's simplicity makes it ideal for writing scripts to automate repetitive tasks.

docs.title: Getting Started with Python
docs.text:
To start using Python, follow these steps:

  1. Install Python Download and install Python from the official website: python.org.

  2. Learn the Basics Explore Python's syntax and core concepts using online tutorials, such as the Python Beginner's Guide.

  3. Practice Coding Use platforms like LeetCode and HackerRank to practice coding problems and improve your skills.

  4. Explore Libraries and Frameworks Start experimenting with popular libraries like NumPy, Pandas, and Matplotlib to build projects and gain hands-on experience.

docs.title: Additional Resources
docs.text:
Here are some useful resources to deepen your Python knowledge:

  • Official Python Documentation
  • Real Python Tutorials
  • Python Package Index (PyPI)

Python's versatility and ease of use make it an excellent language for developers of all levels. Whether you're building a web application, analyzing data, or exploring artificial intelligence, Python has the tools and community to support your journey.

docs.title: Docker and Docker Compose Installation Guide
Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Ubuntu 20.04 LTS or Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (recommended)
  • sudo access on the system
  • Stable internet connection

docs.title: 1. Update System Packages
docs.text:
Ensure your system packages are up-to-date:

sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y

docs.title: 2. Install Required Dependencies
docs.text:
Install packages to allow apt to use HTTPS repositories:

sudo apt install -y \
    ca-certificates \
    curl \
    gnupg \
    lsb-release

docs.title: 3. Add Docker’s Official GPG Key
docs.text:
Import Docker's GPG key for secure package verification:

sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings
curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg

docs.title: 4. Set Up Docker Repository
docs.text:
Add the Docker repository to APT sources:

echo \
  "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu \
  $(lsb_release -cs) stable" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null

docs.title: 5. Install Docker Engine
docs.text:
1. Update the package index: 

    sudo apt update

  2. Install Docker components: 

    sudo apt install -y \
    docker-ce \
    docker-ce-cli \
    containerd.io \
    docker-buildx-plugin

docs.title: 6. Install Docker Compose
docs.text:
1. Download the Docker Compose binary (replace v2.27.0 with the latest release if needed): 

    sudo curl -SL https://github.com/docker/compose/releases/download/v2.27.0/docker-compose-linux-x86_64 -o /usr/local/bin/docker-compose

  2. Apply executable permissions: 

    sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/docker-compose

docs.title: A. Manage Docker as a Non-Root User
docs.text:
Add your user to the docker group to run Docker without sudo: 

sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
Reboot or log out/in for changes to take effect.

docs.title: B. Enable Docker Service at Boot
docs.text:
sudo systemctl enable docker.service
sudo systemctl enable containerd.service

docs.title: 8. Verify Installation
docs.text:
1. Check Docker version: 

    docker --version

  2. Check Docker Compose version: 

    docker-compose --version

  3. Test Docker functionality: 

    docker run hello-world

docs.title: Remove Docker
docs.text:
sudo apt purge -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io
sudo rm -rf /var/lib/docker
sudo rm -rf /var/lib/containerd

docs.title: Remove Docker Compose
docs.text: sudo rm /usr/local/bin/docker-compose

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
• Docker and Docker Compose are now ready for containerized workflows.
  • Use docker-compose up to start multi-container applications.

docs.title: Docker 安裝指南 - Ubuntu
docs.text: 本文檔將指導您如何在 Ubuntu 系統上安裝 Docker Engine 和 Docker Compose。

docs.title: 系統需求
docs.text:
• Ubuntu 版本：20.04 LTS 或更新版本
  • 具有 sudo 權限的用戶帳戶
  • 終端機訪問權限

docs.title: 1. 更新系統套件
docs.text:
sudo apt update
sudo apt upgrade -y

docs.title: 2. 安裝必要的依賴套件
docs.text:
sudo apt install -y \
    apt-transport-https \
    ca-certificates \
    curl \
    gnupg \
    lsb-release

docs.title: 3. 添加 Docker 官方 GPG 密鑰
docs.text: curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg

docs.title: 4. 設置 Docker 倉庫
docs.text:
echo \
  "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu \
  $(lsb_release -cs) stable" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null

docs.title: 5. 安裝 Docker Engine

sudo apt update
sudo apt install -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io

docs.title: 6. 驗證安裝
docs.text: sudo docker run hello-world

docs.title: 7. 將當前用戶添加到 docker 群組（可選但推薦）

sudo usermod -aG docker $USER

注意：添加用戶到 docker 群組後需要重新登入才能生效

docs.title: 1. 下載最新版本的 Docker Compose
docs.text: sudo curl -L "https://github.com/docker/compose/releases/latest/download/docker-compose-$(uname -s)-$(uname -m)" -o /usr/local/bin/docker-compose

docs.title: 2. 設置執行權限

docs.title: 3. 驗證安裝

docs.title: Docker 服務無法啟動
docs.text:
如果 Docker 服務無法啟動，可以嘗試以下命令： 

sudo systemctl start docker
sudo systemctl enable docker

docs.title: 查看 Docker 服務狀態
docs.text: sudo systemctl status docker

docs.title: 移除舊版本 Docker
docs.text:
如果需要移除舊版本的 Docker： 

sudo apt remove docker docker-engine docker.io containerd runc

docs.title: 1. 檢查 Docker 版本
docs.text:
docker --version
docker-compose --version

docs.title: 2. 檢查 Docker 系統信息
docs.text: docker info

docs.title: 3. 列出所有運行中的容器

docs.title: 4. 列出所有容器（包括已停止的）

docs.title: Docker
docs.text: Docker is an open-source platform designed to help developers build, deploy, and run applications inside lightweight, portable containers. Containers are a standardized unit of software that packages up code and all its dependencies, ensuring that the application runs seamlessly across different computing environments.

docs.title: Why Use Docker?
docs.text:
Docker has become a popular tool for developers and organizations due to its numerous benefits:

  1. Portability: Docker containers can run consistently across different environments, including development, testing, and production.
  2. Efficiency: Containers are lightweight and share the host operating system's kernel, reducing overhead compared to traditional virtual machines.
  3. Scalability: Docker makes it easy to scale applications horizontally by spinning up multiple containers.
  4. Isolation: Each container runs in its own isolated environment, preventing conflicts between applications.
  5. Rapid Deployment: Docker images can be built and deployed quickly, speeding up the development lifecycle.

docs.title: Key Components of Docker
docs.text:
Docker consists of several key components that work together to enable containerization:

  • Docker Engine: The core of Docker, responsible for building, running, and managing containers.
  • Docker Images: Immutable templates used to create containers. Images include the application code, libraries, and dependencies.
  • Docker Containers: Running instances of Docker images. Containers are isolated environments where applications run.
  • Docker Hub: A cloud-based registry for sharing and distributing Docker images.

docs.title: Basic Docker Commands
docs.text: Here are some essential Docker commands to get started:

docs.title: 1. Pulling an Image
docs.text:
Download an image from Docker Hub: 

docker pull <image-name>

docs.title: 2. Running a Container
docs.text:
Start a container from an image: 

docker run <image-name>

docs.title: 3. Listing Containers
docs.text:
View all running containers: 

docker ps

View all containers (including stopped ones): 

docker ps -a

docs.title: 4. Stopping a Container
docs.text:
Stop a running container: 

docker stop <container-id>

docs.title: 5. Removing a Container
docs.text:
Remove a stopped container: 

docker rm <container-id>

docs.title: 6. Building an Image
docs.text:
Build a Docker image from a Dockerfile: 

docker build -t <image-name> .

docs.title: Example: Running a Simple Web Server
docs.text:
Here’s how you can use Docker to run a simple web server using the official Nginx image:

  1. Pull the Nginx image: 

    docker pull nginx

  2. Run the Nginx container: 

    docker run -d -p 8080:80 nginx

  3. Open your browser and navigate to http://localhost:8080 to see the Nginx welcome page.

docs.title: Best Practices for Using Docker
docs.text:
To make the most out of Docker, follow these best practices:

  • Use lightweight base images to reduce image size.
  • Keep your Dockerfile clean and organized.
  • Avoid running multiple processes in a single container.
  • Regularly update images to include security patches.
  • Use .dockerignore to exclude unnecessary files from the build context.

Docker simplifies the process of building, testing, and deploying applications, making it an essential tool for modern software development. By learning and adopting Docker, you can improve the efficiency, scalability, and reliability of your projects.

docs.title: MkDocs
docs.text: MkDocs is a fast, simple, and open-source static site generator that's specifically designed for creating project documentation. It is written in Python and uses Markdown for content creation, making it an excellent choice for developers looking to create clean, professional documentation.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
MkDocs offers several key features that make it stand out:

  • Simple Configuration: Configuration is managed through a single mkdocs.yml file.
  • Markdown Support: Write your documentation using Markdown, a lightweight and easy-to-read formatting syntax.
  • Built-in Themes: Comes with a variety of themes, including the popular mkdocs-material theme.
  • Live Preview: The built-in development server provides a live preview of your documentation as you edit.
  • Static Site Output: Generates a static HTML site that can be hosted anywhere, such as GitHub Pages, Netlify, or your own server.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
MkDocs can be installed using pip, the Python package manager. Follow these steps to install it:

  1. Ensure you have Python installed on your system.
  2. Run the following command to install MkDocs:
pip install mkdocs
  1. Verify the installation by checking the version:
mkdocs --version

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Creating a new MkDocs project is straightforward. Here’s how you can get started:

  1. Create a New Project: 
    mkdocs new my-project
cd my-project

This creates a new directory called my-project with the basic structure for an MkDocs project.

  1. Run the Development Server: 
    mkdocs serve

This starts a local development server at http://127.0.0.1:8000/. Any changes made to your Markdown files will automatically update in the browser.

  1. Build the Documentation: 
    mkdocs build

This generates a static site in the site/ directory, ready to be deployed.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The configuration for MkDocs is managed in the mkdocs.yml file. Below is an example configuration:

site_name: My Documentation
theme: readthedocs
nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - About: about.md
  - Contact: contact.md

You can customize the navigation, theme, and other settings to suit your needs.

docs.title: Deploying Your Documentation
docs.text:
Once you've built your documentation, you can deploy it to any static hosting service. Here’s an example of deploying to GitHub Pages:

  1. Add the following to your mkdocs.yml file: 
    site_url: https://<your-username>.github.io/<your-repo>/
  2. Use the built-in gh-deploy command: 
    mkdocs gh-deploy

This will push the site/ directory to the gh-pages branch of your repository.

With MkDocs, creating and managing documentation becomes a seamless process. Its simplicity, combined with powerful features, makes it a go-to tool for developers and technical writers alike.
